title: Medvedev Breaks Grand Slam Losing Streak with Australian Open Victory
summary: Daniil Medvedev, a Russian tennis player and former world number one, ended a 370-day losing streak at Grand Slam tournaments by winning his first-round match at the 2025 Australian Open. He defeated Dutch player Jesper de Jong in straight sets, 7-5, 6-2, 7-6 (7-2), at Melbourne Park. This victory comes after Medvedev suffered first-round exits at the French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open in 2025, highlighting a difficult year where his ranking dropped as low as 18th. Medvedev attributes his success to a conscious effort to maintain a positive attitude on the court, mirroring his outlook in life. He had previously won the Brisbane International earlier in January, bringing his season record to 6-0. Despite past incidents, such as destroying a net camera during a match, Medvedev is focusing on improvement and resilience. This win marks a turning point in his career, helping him regain confidence after a turbulent period that included missing the ATP Finals.
